Question.Subject: Running multiple blogs?
Question.Content: I'm trying to set up a blog but I have some questions about the mechanics of covering various topics. I want to blog on 5 things: News commentary Travel Photography Personal Life Food But here's the catch. I want each of the topics to have a unique URL and look. Also I would like all of them to also post to a master blog. That master blog would be a hub of sorts where you could link to the individual blogs. What is the best way to go about this? I want it to be easy to work on each blog and if I could do it under one user name that would be great. I'm using wordpress hosted on my own site. I have a host with wordpress installed and I own a couple of domain names. I'm interested in the specific mechanics of creating a master feed for several blogs to feed into.
Question.ChosenAnswer: I would recommend trying out b2evolution. It can do multiple blogs for you.

As you may know a domain name is just a name, not a real website/weblog. If you are going to create your blog website: 1- Buy a domain name. A domain name is a name you want to call your website (ex: www.yahoo.com). To get a domain name, you have to pay an annual fee to a registrar for the right to use that name. 2- Buy a web hosting service to provide your online space and enable you to get your blog online at your purchased domain name.
